service.name: e2guardian
service.description: Full content Open Source web content filter

field.description: Enable or disable E2guardian service.

Default: LAN/loopback
Select interface(s) that you want to e2guardian to listen on.
Note: Do NOT select more then one interface if you plan to use more then one authentication plugin.

Default: 8080
The port(s) that DansGuardian listens to.
If checked, the users connected to the interface(s) selected in the 'Proxy interface(s)' field will be allowed to use the proxy.
field.sethelp: This options must be selected to use bandwidth limit options under Groups tab.

field.description:
Limit non transparent clients bandwidth to this limiter.
You can configure limiters under firewall -> traffic shaper -> limiters
Do not forget to apply a mask on limiter if you want to define a per user/ip limit. and check Allow Users on Interface option above.
NOTE: To match transparent clients too, apply limiters under firewall -> rules that allows access to this firewall(127.0.0.1) under Listen port(s).

Choose the Out queue/Virtual interface only if In is also selected.
The Out selection is applied to traffic leaving the interface where the rule is created, the In selection is applied to traffic coming into the chosen interface.
Daemon Options. Default values are in ( )

Select action to do on E2guardian daemon within applyconfig.
Sending a USR1 to the e2guardian process allows changes to be applied without killing the e2g process (and subsequently any active connections)

option.name: Kill any running copy and start a new one
Reload lists and groups files issuing a USR1

field.description:
Default: 256
This figure is the maximum number of concurrent connections.
If more connections are made, connections will queue until a worker thread is free.
On large site you might want to try 2500 (max value 20000)
Enable transparent mode to forward all requests for destination port 80 to the proxy server.
field.sethelp:
Transparent proxy mode works without any additional configuration being necessary on clients.
Important: Transparent mode will filter SSL (port 443) if you enable 'HTTPS/SSL Interception' below.
Hint: In order to proxy both HTTP and HTTPS protocols without intercepting SSL connections, configure WPAD/PAC options on your DNS/DHCP servers.

field.description: The interface(s) the proxy server will transparently intercept requests on. Use CTRL + click to select multiple interfaces.

field.fielddescr: Bypass Proxy for Private Address Destination
field.description: Do not forward traffic to Private Address Space (RFC 1918) destinations.
field.sethelp: Destinations in Private Address Space (RFC 1918) are passed directly through the firewall, not through the proxy server.

field.fielddescr: Bypass Proxy for These Source IPs
field.description:
Do not forward traffic from these source IPs, CIDR nets, hostnames, or aliases through the proxy server but let it pass directly through the firewall.
Applies only to transparent mode. Separate entries by semi-colons (;)

field.fielddescr: Bypass Proxy for These Destination IPs
field.description:
Do not proxy traffic going to these destination IPs, CIDR nets, hostnames, or aliases, but let it pass directly through the firewall.
Applies only to transparent mode. Separate entries by semi-colons (;)
Check to enable E2guardian SSL interception.

Select Certificate Authority to use when SSL filtering is enabled on Group options
To create a CA on pfsense, go to system -> Cert Manager
This is the port the proxy server will listen on to intercept SSL while using transparent proxy. Default: 8081

Select parent proxy to use.
Automatic mode will configure a squid daemon to be used as parent for e2guardian.

option.name: Manual configure Remote proxy or Local Squid package

field.description:
Default: 127.0.0.1
Sets ip address for proxy server(usually squid).

Default: 8080
Sets port number for proxy server.
This option handles max time to wait for proxy server.
Check to enable E2guardian process watchdog and auto restart.
